conclusion: To determine the height H above the ground at which the fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building, we need to analyze the projectile's motion in both the horizontal and vertical directions.
Given: Muzzle velocity v0 = 50 m/s, Launch angle θ = 53°
The horizontal component of the initial velocity v0x is: v0x = v0 cos θ = 50 cos 53° = 50 × 0.6 = 30 m/s
The vertical component of the initial velocity v0y is: v0y = v0 sin θ = 50 sin 53° = 50 × 0.8 = 40 m/s
The horizontal distance L is 60 meters, and the horizontal motion is not affected by gravity.
Solving for time t: t = L / v0x = 60 / 30 = 2 s
The vertical displacement H can be determined using the equation for vertical motion: H = v0y × t - (1/2) g t^2
Given: v0y = 40 m/s, g = 10 m/s², t = 2 s

premise: v0y = 40 m/s, g = 10 m/s², t = 2 s

conclusion: The height H above the ground at which the fire extinguishing projectile hits the high-rise building is 60 m.
